message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.MM. 

The paper focuses on training and evaluating effective word embeddings with both text and visual information, which suggests that it could belong to several sub-categories. 

cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category as the paper deals with natural language processing and word embeddings. 

cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is also a likely sub-category as the paper involves large-scale image datasets and multimodal models that incorporate visual information. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another possible sub-category as the paper proposes and compares several Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) based multimodal models. 

cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is a possible sub-category as the paper constructs an evaluation dataset to directly assess the effectiveness of word embeddings in terms of finding semantically similar or related words and phrases. 

cs.MM (Multimedia) is also a possible sub-category as the paper deals with multimodal models that incorporate both text and visual information.
